hints_html:
This is a bernoulli experiment.

The formula for probability \(p\), number of trials \(N\) and success \(k\) is

\[\begin{aligned} P(X=k)=\begin{pmatrix}N\\k\end{pmatrix}p^k(1-p)^{N-k}.\end{aligned}\]

(Often \(\begin{pmatrix}N\\k\end{pmatrix} = \frac{N!}{(N-k)!k!}\) is written as C(N,k).)

sols_html:
By using the formula for the bernoulli experiment

\(P(X=k)=\begin{pmatrix}N\\k\end{pmatrix}p^k(1-p)^{N-k}\)

for \(p=0.7\), \(N=10\) and \(k=8\) and get

\(P(X=8)=\begin{pmatrix}10\\8\end{pmatrix}0.7^8\cdot(0.3)^{2}=45\cdot0.7^8\cdot0.3^2\)

So, the answer is (a).

statement_html:
Multiple Choice question: Select ONE correct answer. You will not be graded for any work.

Each mouse born with a certain genetic mutation has probability 0.7 of contracting a certain disease. Out of 10 mice born with the mutation, the probability that exactly 8 will contract the disease is

(a) 45(.7)8(.3)2

(b) 0.7(0.3)7

(c) 1/11

(d) 8/10

(e) 45/210
